newsitem.title: USA: Salton/Maxim ups credit pact to $75 mln.
newsitem.headline: Salton/Maxim ups credit pact to $75 mln.

text.p: Salton/Maxim Housewares Inc said Tuesday it raised to $75 million from $45 million a secured financing agreement, which significantly increased its working capital while reducing the cost of borrowing.
The agreement with Foothill Capital Corp is a three-year revolving loan with annual renewal options. Foothill Capital is a unit of Foothill Group Inc.
"We have taken this step to help position ourselves for the traditionally important fall selling season and steady long-term growth," said Leon Dreimann, president of Salton/Maxim, in a news release.

The new facility was completed at one percentage point over prime, compared with the company's previous borrowing rate with Foothill Capital of two points over prime. It includes a provision, tied to the London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR), for additional rate reduction on up to 75 percent of outstanding borrowings. The company may also further reduce its interest rate by meeting certain performance provisions. Salton/Maxim designs and markets small kitchen appliances and beauty care products.
Shares of Salton/Maxim closed yesterday at 8-6/16.
